What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Share your thoughts below—I’d love to hear from all the data storytellers out there! 🙌 hashtag#MarketResearch hashtag#DataAnalytics hashtag#CustomerInsights

🚀 [We're Hiring] Work with a Leading Gaming AdTech Company Based in Bali! 🌴I'm currently assisting a fast-growing, Bali-based AdTech company that operates at the intersection of mobile gaming, advertising, and analytics. They are expanding their team and looking to hire two key positions to support their continued growth and global operations.🎯 1. QA Specialist (Web & Tracking Systems)📍 Onsite | Bali, IndonesiaAs a QA Specialist, you'll be the gatekeeper of quality across web platforms and event tracking systems. Your precision will ensure seamless data flow and campaign performance for millions of gaming users worldwide.What You’ll Do:- Design and execute test cases for web-based features, APIs, and event tracking- Validate conversion tracking across multiple systems and platforms- Use SQL queries to ensure data consistency and accuracy- Collaborate cross-functionally with engineers, product managers, and analysts- Track bugs using Jira and perform API testing using Postman or Katalon- Support dashboard sanity testing using Redash or LookerWhat We're Looking For:- Minimum 2 years of experience in QA for digital/web products- Hands-on knowledge of event tracking systems and conversion flows- Solid understanding of web architecture and debugging- Familiarity with tracking tools like Appsflyer, Segment, or Branch is a plus- Strong problem-solving and communication skills📊 2. Data Analyst (Mobile App Product Focus)📍 Onsite | Bali, IndonesiaThis role is perfect for someone who thrives on transforming raw data into powerful business insights. You’ll be working directly with product and marketing teams to optimize user experience and drive performance for mobile gaming products.What You’ll Do:- Analyze product and campaign performance for mobile applications- Conduct LTV analysis, user behavior analysis, and retention metrics- Partner with cross-functional teams to define KPIs and data strategies- Develop and maintain real-time dashboards (Tableau) for business monitoring- Identify actionable insights that improve acquisition, retention, and monetization- Ensure data quality through structured data cleansing and SQL queryingWhat We're Looking For:- At least 2 years of experience as a Data Analyst for mobile app-based products- Strong understanding of end-to-end data analysis and visualization- Proven track record in LTV analysis and campaign performance reviews- Proficiency in SQL, Tableau, and Excel/Google SheetsBonus: Familiarity with attribution tools or basic Python scripting📩 Interested? Apply today sending your application straight to my email at glenn@glints.com with subject: PositionName_YourName or just drop a DM to my LinkedIn.Don't let this chance pass you by - connect with me today!Know someone that might be interested in applying?Kindly refer them to this Job Ad!hashtag#techhiring hashtag#datajobs hashtag#QAjobs hashtag#gamingindustry hashtag#baliopportunities hashtag#adtech hashtag#careeropportunity

What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Share your thoughts below—I’d love to hear from all the data storytellers out there! 🙌 hashtag#MarketResearch hashtag#DataAnalytics hashtag#CustomerInsights

What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Share your thoughts below—I’d love to hear from all the data storytellers out there! 🙌 hashtag#MarketResearch hashtag#DataAnalytics hashtag#CustomerInsights

They are expanding their team and looking to hire two key positions to support their continued growth and global operations.🎯 1. QA Specialist (Web & Tracking Systems)📍 Onsite | Bali, IndonesiaAs a QA Specialist, you'll be the gatekeeper of quality across web platforms and event tracking systems. Your precision will ensure seamless data flow and campaign performance for millions of gaming users worldwide.What You’ll Do:- Design and execute test cases for web-based features, APIs, and event tracking- Validate conversion tracking across multiple systems and platforms- Use SQL queries to ensure data consistency and accuracy- Collaborate cross-functionally with engineers, product managers, and analysts- Track bugs using Jira and perform API testing using Postman or Katalon- Support dashboard sanity testing using Redash or LookerWhat We're Looking For:- Minimum 2 years of experience in QA for digital/web products- Hands-on knowledge of event tracking systems and conversion flows- Solid understanding of web architecture and debugging- Familiarity with tracking tools like Appsflyer, Segment, or Branch is a plus- Strong problem-solving and communication skills📊 2. I've been searching for my next role for a while now and the process has been challenging. I know I'm not the only one and I usually have the mindset of "trusting the process". The process, on the other hand, took longer than I expected. I'm grateful thought, that there has been a lot of people helped and showed their support during this time, I'm thankful for all. I want to mention a specific tool called Huntr which made my job search 100x easier. This also led me get connected to Sam Wright. Although, our conversation was short, it was super insightful. Thank you both. I feel empowered to continue the search full-speed. If you are also looking for your next role, I highly recommend signing up for Huntr.Hopefully the next post you will hear from me is the announcement I've been waiting to make.A little bit about me: I’ve built platforms that scale, streamlined user experiences, and tackled everything from real-time collaboration tools to data-driven applications. Whether it’s optimizing frontends for performance, architecting maintainable systems, or diving into API design, I bring a builder’s mindset and a problem-solving approach to everything I do.What I’m Looking For:- Mid-Senior Software Engineer roles (Frontend, Full-Stack, or Specialized)- Exciting products, challenges, and growth opportunities- Open to remote, hybrid, or on-site—let’s talk!If you’re hiring or know a team looking for an experienced engineer, I’d love to connect. Also, a like, comment, or share could help get this post in front of the right people. What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Share your thoughts below—I’d love to hear from all the data storytellers out there! 🙌 hashtag#MarketResearch hashtag#DataAnalytics hashtag#CustomerInsights

What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Share your thoughts below—I’d love to hear from all the data storytellers out there! 🙌 hashtag#MarketResearch hashtag#DataAnalytics hashtag#CustomerInsights

🚀 [We're Hiring] Work with a Leading Gaming AdTech Company Based in Bali! 🌴I'm currently assisting a fast-growing, Bali-based AdTech company that operates at the intersection of mobile gaming, advertising, and analytics. They are expanding their team and looking to hire two key positions to support their continued growth and global operations.🎯 1. QA Specialist (Web & Tracking Systems)📍 Onsite | Bali, IndonesiaAs a QA Specialist, you'll be the gatekeeper of quality across web platforms and event tracking systems. What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Share your thoughts below—I’d love to hear from all the data storytellers out there! 🙌 hashtag#MarketResearch hashtag#DataAnalytics hashtag#CustomerInsights

I've been searching for my next role for a while now and the process has been challenging. I know I'm not the only one and I usually have the mindset of "trusting the process". The process, on the other hand, took longer than I expected. I'm grateful thought, that there has been a lot of people helped and showed their support during this time, I'm thankful for all. I want to mention a specific tool called Huntr which made my job search 100x easier. This also led me get connected to Sam Wright. Although, our conversation was short, it was super insightful. Data Engineer ≠ Data Analyst ≠ ML EngineerLet’s break it down:✅ Data Engineer → Builds, optimizes, and maintains data pipelines, warehouses, and infrastructure.Tech stack: Spark, Kafka, Airflow, Snowflake, BigQuery, Hadoop, dbt✅ Data Analyst → Analyzes and visualizes data, builds reports, identifies trends & insights to support business decisions.Tech stack: SQL, Excel, Tableau, Power BI, Looker✅ ML Engineer → Builds, deploys, and maintains machine learning models in production.Tech stack: Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, MLflow, Kubeflow💡Key takeaway: These roles complement each other but require very different skill sets.If you’re applying or hiring — make sure you’re clear on the differences!Happy to help anyone looking to pivot or clarify their path. Feel free to DM and follow Eesha Srivastava.hashtag#softwarenengineering hashtag#dataengineering hashtag#coding hashtag#networking

What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Share your thoughts below—I’d love to hear from all the data storytellers out there! 🙌 hashtag#MarketResearch hashtag#DataAnalytics hashtag#CustomerInsights

Data Engineer ≠ Data Analyst ≠ ML EngineerLet’s break it down:✅ Data Engineer → Builds, optimizes, and maintains data pipelines, warehouses, and infrastructure.Tech stack: Spark, Kafka, Airflow, Snowflake, BigQuery, Hadoop, dbt✅ Data Analyst → Analyzes and visualizes data, builds reports, identifies trends & insights to support business decisions.Tech stack: SQL, Excel, Tableau, Power BI, Looker✅ ML Engineer → Builds, deploys, and maintains machine learning models in production.Tech stack: Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, MLflow, Kubeflow💡Key takeaway: These roles complement each other but require very different skill sets.If you’re applying or hiring — make sure you’re clear on the differences!Happy to help anyone looking to pivot or clarify their path. Feel free to DM and follow Eesha Srivastava.hashtag#softwarenengineering hashtag#dataengineering hashtag#coding hashtag#networking

What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Share your thoughts below—I’d love to hear from all the data storytellers out there! 🙌 hashtag#MarketResearch hashtag#DataAnalytics hashtag#CustomerInsights

Data Engineer ≠ Data Analyst ≠ ML EngineerLet’s break it down:✅ Data Engineer → Builds, optimizes, and maintains data pipelines, warehouses, and infrastructure.Tech stack: Spark, Kafka, Airflow, Snowflake, BigQuery, Hadoop, dbt✅ Data Analyst → Analyzes and visualizes data, builds reports, identifies trends & insights to support business decisions.Tech stack: SQL, Excel, Tableau, Power BI, Looker✅ ML Engineer → Builds, deploys, and maintains machine learning models in production.Tech stack: Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, MLflow, Kubeflow💡Key takeaway: These roles complement each other but require very different skill sets.If you’re applying or hiring — make sure you’re clear on the differences!Happy to help anyone looking to pivot or clarify their path. What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Data Engineer ≠ Data Analyst ≠ ML EngineerLet’s break it down:✅ Data Engineer → Builds, optimizes, and maintains data pipelines, warehouses, and infrastructure.Tech stack: Spark, Kafka, Airflow, Snowflake, BigQuery, Hadoop, dbt✅ Data Analyst → Analyzes and visualizes data, builds reports, identifies trends & insights to support business decisions.Tech stack: SQL, Excel, Tableau, Power BI, Looker✅ ML Engineer → Builds, deploys, and maintains machine learning models in production.Tech stack: Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, MLflow, Kubeflow💡Key takeaway: These roles complement each other but require very different skill sets.If you’re applying or hiring — make sure you’re clear on the differences!Happy to help anyone looking to pivot or clarify their path. What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Data Engineer ≠ Data Analyst ≠ ML EngineerLet’s break it down:✅ Data Engineer → Builds, optimizes, and maintains data pipelines, warehouses, and infrastructure.Tech stack: Spark, Kafka, Airflow, Snowflake, BigQuery, Hadoop, dbt✅ Data Analyst → Analyzes and visualizes data, builds reports, identifies trends & insights to support business decisions.Tech stack: SQL, Excel, Tableau, Power BI, Looker✅ ML Engineer → Builds, deploys, and maintains machine learning models in production.Tech stack: Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, MLflow, Kubeflow💡Key takeaway: These roles complement each other but require very different skill sets.If you’re applying or hiring — make sure you’re clear on the differences!Happy to help anyone looking to pivot or clarify their path. Feel free to DM and follow Eesha Srivastava.hashtag#softwarenengineering hashtag#dataengineering hashtag#coding hashtag#networking

What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Data Engineer ≠ Data Analyst ≠ ML EngineerLet’s break it down:✅ Data Engineer → Builds, optimizes, and maintains data pipelines, warehouses, and infrastructure.Tech stack: Spark, Kafka, Airflow, Snowflake, BigQuery, Hadoop, dbt✅ Data Analyst → Analyzes and visualizes data, builds reports, identifies trends & insights to support business decisions.Tech stack: SQL, Excel, Tableau, Power BI, Looker✅ ML Engineer → Builds, deploys, and maintains machine learning models in production.Tech stack: Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, MLflow, Kubeflow💡Key takeaway: These roles complement each other but require very different skill sets.If you’re applying or hiring — make sure you’re clear on the differences!Happy to help anyone looking to pivot or clarify their path. Feel free to DM and follow Eesha Srivastava.hashtag#softwarenengineering hashtag#dataengineering hashtag#coding hashtag#networking

What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Share your thoughts below—I’d love to hear from all the data storytellers out there! 🙌 hashtag#MarketResearch hashtag#DataAnalytics hashtag#CustomerInsights

Data Engineer ≠ Data Analyst ≠ ML EngineerLet’s break it down:✅ Data Engineer → Builds, optimizes, and maintains data pipelines, warehouses, and infrastructure.Tech stack: Spark, Kafka, Airflow, Snowflake, BigQuery, Hadoop, dbt✅ Data Analyst → Analyzes and visualizes data, builds reports, identifies trends & insights to support business decisions.Tech stack: SQL, Excel, Tableau, Power BI, Looker✅ ML Engineer → Builds, deploys, and maintains machine learning models in production.Tech stack: Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, MLflow, Kubeflow💡Key takeaway: These roles complement each other but require very different skill sets.If you’re applying or hiring — make sure you’re clear on the differences!Happy to help anyone looking to pivot or clarify their path. What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Share your thoughts below—I’d love to hear from all the data storytellers out there! 🙌 hashtag#MarketResearch hashtag#DataAnalytics hashtag#CustomerInsights

Data Engineer ≠ Data Analyst ≠ ML EngineerLet’s break it down:✅ Data Engineer → Builds, optimizes, and maintains data pipelines, warehouses, and infrastructure.Tech stack: Spark, Kafka, Airflow, Snowflake, BigQuery, Hadoop, dbt✅ Data Analyst → Analyzes and visualizes data, builds reports, identifies trends & insights to support business decisions.Tech stack: SQL, Excel, Tableau, Power BI, Looker✅ ML Engineer → Builds, deploys, and maintains machine learning models in production.Tech stack: Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, MLflow, Kubeflow💡Key takeaway: These roles complement each other but require very different skill sets.If you’re applying or hiring — make sure you’re clear on the differences!Happy to help anyone looking to pivot or clarify their path. What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Data Engineer ≠ Data Analyst ≠ ML EngineerLet’s break it down:✅ Data Engineer → Builds, optimizes, and maintains data pipelines, warehouses, and infrastructure.Tech stack: Spark, Kafka, Airflow, Snowflake, BigQuery, Hadoop, dbt✅ Data Analyst → Analyzes and visualizes data, builds reports, identifies trends & insights to support business decisions.Tech stack: SQL, Excel, Tableau, Power BI, Looker✅ ML Engineer → Builds, deploys, and maintains machine learning models in production.Tech stack: Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, MLflow, Kubeflow💡Key takeaway: These roles complement each other but require very different skill sets.If you’re applying or hiring — make sure you’re clear on the differences!Happy to help anyone looking to pivot or clarify their path. What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Data Engineer ≠ Data Analyst ≠ ML EngineerLet’s break it down:✅ Data Engineer → Builds, optimizes, and maintains data pipelines, warehouses, and infrastructure.Tech stack: Spark, Kafka, Airflow, Snowflake, BigQuery, Hadoop, dbt✅ Data Analyst → Analyzes and visualizes data, builds reports, identifies trends & insights to support business decisions.Tech stack: SQL, Excel, Tableau, Power BI, Looker✅ ML Engineer → Builds, deploys, and maintains machine learning models in production.Tech stack: Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, MLflow, Kubeflow💡Key takeaway: These roles complement each other but require very different skill sets.If you’re applying or hiring — make sure you’re clear on the differences!Happy to help anyone looking to pivot or clarify their path. What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Data Engineer ≠ Data Analyst ≠ ML EngineerLet’s break it down:✅ Data Engineer → Builds, optimizes, and maintains data pipelines, warehouses, and infrastructure.Tech stack: Spark, Kafka, Airflow, Snowflake, BigQuery, Hadoop, dbt✅ Data Analyst → Analyzes and visualizes data, builds reports, identifies trends & insights to support business decisions.Tech stack: SQL, Excel, Tableau, Power BI, Looker✅ ML Engineer → Builds, deploys, and maintains machine learning models in production.Tech stack: Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, MLflow, Kubeflow💡Key takeaway: These roles complement each other but require very different skill sets.If you’re applying or hiring — make sure you’re clear on the differences!Happy to help anyone looking to pivot or clarify their path. Feel free to DM and follow Eesha Srivastava.hashtag#softwarenengineering hashtag#dataengineering hashtag#coding hashtag#networking

What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Hey incredible LinkedIn folks across the globe! 🌍I’m thrilled to share my journey of cracking the Sliding Window Maximum problem from LeetCode, a fascinating coding challenge. Whether you’re a tech enthusiast or just curious about what coders do, I’ve tailored this for everyone. I’m reaching out to Software Engineers, Backend Developers, Full Stack Developers, and hiring managers at startups, MAANG giants, and MNCs worldwide. Let’s connect and inspire each other! 🚀✨🌟 What’s This About? 🍽️Imagine sliding a small tray over a buffet table, picking the tastiest dish from each set. It’s a fun way to think about this problem!🌍 Real-World Relevance 🛒For non-tech folks, it’s like finding the best deal in a moving set of options; for techies, it’s spotting the largest number in a sliding window of a list.📊 Why It Matters 🧪This is a classic problem in data processing, often seen in interviews, testing how you handle efficiency.🕒 Common Use 📈Think of stock price analysis or real-time data streams where you need quick insights from moving data chunks.🔧 My Quick Approach 🧠I avoided the slow “check every single thing” method and used a smart “VIP list” (hint: a priority structure) to track potential top picks, updating as I slide. Super fast for big data! ⚡🛠️ Step 1: Understand 📝First, I broke down the idea of a moving frame over numbers, ensuring I knew exactly what to find.⚡ Step 2: Optimize ⏩Instead of rechecking everything, my VIP list only keeps track of numbers that could be the biggest, saving time.📋 Step 3: Execute ✅As the window moves, I update this list by dropping outdated or smaller values, always having the top number ready.📈 What I Learned 💪I mastered efficiency for scalable systems and how to explain complex ideas simply. A huge win for teamwork and real-world projects! 🌟🌱 Skill Growth 🚀This taught me to prioritize speed in coding, crucial for apps handling tons of data without lagging.🗣️ Communication 💬Simplifying this problem honed my ability to share tech concepts with non-tech teammates or clients.💡 Problem-Solving 🕵️‍♂️It reinforced my knack for finding creative shortcuts, a skill I’m eager to apply in professional settings.🤝 Why Share This? 🌎I’m hashtag#OpentoWork for hybrid/remote roles, especially in India, at startups or MAANG companies. Hiring Managers, Recruiters, HR pros-let’s talk! Tech pals, let’s swap ideas! 📢📩 Open to Connect 📧I’m keen to discuss opportunities where I can contribute to innovative tech solutions.🌐 Global Reach 🗺️I’m looking for roles worldwide, bringing adaptability and a passion for learning to any team.🤲 Collaboration 👥I’d love to brainstorm with fellow developers on this or other challenges to grow together.hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#BackendDeveloper hashtag#FullStackDeveloper hashtag#Python hashtag#Coding hashtag#LeetCode hashtag#TechJobs hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#Startups hashtag#MAANG hashtag#Technology hashtag#Innovation hashtag#Careers hashtag#JobOpening hashtag#Recruitment 🖥️📱📷 See the Visual ✨

What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Share your thoughts below—I’d love to hear from all the data storytellers out there! 🙌 hashtag#MarketResearch hashtag#DataAnalytics hashtag#CustomerInsights

Data Engineer ≠ Data Analyst ≠ ML EngineerLet’s break it down:✅ Data Engineer → Builds, optimizes, and maintains data pipelines, warehouses, and infrastructure.Tech stack: Spark, Kafka, Airflow, Snowflake, BigQuery, Hadoop, dbt✅ Data Analyst → Analyzes and visualizes data, builds reports, identifies trends & insights to support business decisions.Tech stack: SQL, Excel, Tableau, Power BI, Looker✅ ML Engineer → Builds, deploys, and maintains machine learning models in production.Tech stack: Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, MLflow, Kubeflow💡Key takeaway: These roles complement each other but require very different skill sets.If you’re applying or hiring — make sure you’re clear on the differences!Happy to help anyone looking to pivot or clarify their path. Feel free to DM and follow Eesha Srivastava.hashtag#softwarenengineering hashtag#dataengineering hashtag#coding hashtag#networking

Hey incredible LinkedIn folks across the globe! 🌍I’m thrilled to share my journey of cracking the Sliding Window Maximum problem from LeetCode, a fascinating coding challenge. Whether you’re a tech enthusiast or just curious about what coders do, I’ve tailored this for everyone. I’m reaching out to Software Engineers, Backend Developers, Full Stack Developers, and hiring managers at startups, MAANG giants, and MNCs worldwide. Let’s connect and inspire each other! 🚀✨🌟 What’s This About? 🍽️Imagine sliding a small tray over a buffet table, picking the tastiest dish from each set. It’s a fun way to think about this problem!🌍 Real-World Relevance 🛒For non-tech folks, it’s like finding the best deal in a moving set of options; for techies, it’s spotting the largest number in a sliding window of a list.📊 Why It Matters 🧪This is a classic problem in data processing, often seen in interviews, testing how you handle efficiency.🕒 Common Use 📈Think of stock price analysis or real-time data streams where you need quick insights from moving data chunks.🔧 My Quick Approach 🧠I avoided the slow “check every single thing” method and used a smart “VIP list” (hint: a priority structure) to track potential top picks, updating as I slide. Super fast for big data! ⚡🛠️ Step 1: Understand 📝First, I broke down the idea of a moving frame over numbers, ensuring I knew exactly what to find.⚡ Step 2: Optimize ⏩Instead of rechecking everything, my VIP list only keeps track of numbers that could be the biggest, saving time.📋 Step 3: Execute ✅As the window moves, I update this list by dropping outdated or smaller values, always having the top number ready.📈 What I Learned 💪I mastered efficiency for scalable systems and how to explain complex ideas simply. A huge win for teamwork and real-world projects! 🌟🌱 Skill Growth 🚀This taught me to prioritize speed in coding, crucial for apps handling tons of data without lagging.🗣️ Communication 💬Simplifying this problem honed my ability to share tech concepts with non-tech teammates or clients.💡 Problem-Solving 🕵️‍♂️It reinforced my knack for finding creative shortcuts, a skill I’m eager to apply in professional settings.🤝 Why Share This? 🌎I’m hashtag#OpentoWork for hybrid/remote roles, especially in India, at startups or MAANG companies. Hiring Managers, Recruiters, HR pros-let’s talk! Tech pals, let’s swap ideas! 📢📩 Open to Connect 📧I’m keen to discuss opportunities where I can contribute to innovative tech solutions.🌐 Global Reach 🗺️I’m looking for roles worldwide, bringing adaptability and a passion for learning to any team.🤲 Collaboration 👥I’d love to brainstorm with fellow developers on this or other challenges to grow together.hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#BackendDeveloper hashtag#FullStackDeveloper hashtag#Python hashtag#Coding hashtag#LeetCode hashtag#TechJobs hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#Startups hashtag#MAANG hashtag#Technology hashtag#Innovation hashtag#Careers hashtag#JobOpening hashtag#Recruitment 🖥️📱📷 See the Visual ✨

What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Hey incredible LinkedIn folks across the globe! 🌍I’m thrilled to share my journey of cracking the Sliding Window Maximum problem from LeetCode, a fascinating coding challenge. Whether you’re a tech enthusiast or just curious about what coders do, I’ve tailored this for everyone. I’m reaching out to Software Engineers, Backend Developers, Full Stack Developers, and hiring managers at startups, MAANG giants, and MNCs worldwide. Let’s connect and inspire each other! 🚀✨🌟 What’s This About? 🍽️Imagine sliding a small tray over a buffet table, picking the tastiest dish from each set. It’s a fun way to think about this problem!🌍 Real-World Relevance 🛒For non-tech folks, it’s like finding the best deal in a moving set of options; for techies, it’s spotting the largest number in a sliding window of a list.📊 Why It Matters 🧪This is a classic problem in data processing, often seen in interviews, testing how you handle efficiency.🕒 Common Use 📈Think of stock price analysis or real-time data streams where you need quick insights from moving data chunks.🔧 My Quick Approach 🧠I avoided the slow “check every single thing” method and used a smart “VIP list” (hint: a priority structure) to track potential top picks, updating as I slide. Super fast for big data! ⚡🛠️ Step 1: Understand 📝First, I broke down the idea of a moving frame over numbers, ensuring I knew exactly what to find.⚡ Step 2: Optimize ⏩Instead of rechecking everything, my VIP list only keeps track of numbers that could be the biggest, saving time.📋 Step 3: Execute ✅As the window moves, I update this list by dropping outdated or smaller values, always having the top number ready.📈 What I Learned 💪I mastered efficiency for scalable systems and how to explain complex ideas simply. A huge win for teamwork and real-world projects! 🌟🌱 Skill Growth 🚀This taught me to prioritize speed in coding, crucial for apps handling tons of data without lagging.🗣️ Communication 💬Simplifying this problem honed my ability to share tech concepts with non-tech teammates or clients.💡 Problem-Solving 🕵️‍♂️It reinforced my knack for finding creative shortcuts, a skill I’m eager to apply in professional settings.🤝 Why Share This? 🌎I’m hashtag#OpentoWork for hybrid/remote roles, especially in India, at startups or MAANG companies. Hiring Managers, Recruiters, HR pros-let’s talk! Tech pals, let’s swap ideas! 📢📩 Open to Connect 📧I’m keen to discuss opportunities where I can contribute to innovative tech solutions.🌐 Global Reach 🗺️I’m looking for roles worldwide, bringing adaptability and a passion for learning to any team.🤲 Collaboration 👥I’d love to brainstorm with fellow developers on this or other challenges to grow together.hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#BackendDeveloper hashtag#FullStackDeveloper hashtag#Python hashtag#Coding hashtag#LeetCode hashtag#TechJobs hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#Startups hashtag#MAANG hashtag#Technology hashtag#Innovation hashtag#Careers hashtag#JobOpening hashtag#Recruitment 🖥️📱📷 See the Visual ✨

What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Data Engineer ≠ Data Analyst ≠ ML EngineerLet’s break it down:✅ Data Engineer → Builds, optimizes, and maintains data pipelines, warehouses, and infrastructure.Tech stack: Spark, Kafka, Airflow, Snowflake, BigQuery, Hadoop, dbt✅ Data Analyst → Analyzes and visualizes data, builds reports, identifies trends & insights to support business decisions.Tech stack: SQL, Excel, Tableau, Power BI, Looker✅ ML Engineer → Builds, deploys, and maintains machine learning models in production.Tech stack: Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, MLflow, Kubeflow💡Key takeaway: These roles complement each other but require very different skill sets.If you’re applying or hiring — make sure you’re clear on the differences!Happy to help anyone looking to pivot or clarify their path. Hey incredible LinkedIn folks across the globe! 🌍I’m thrilled to share my journey of cracking the Sliding Window Maximum problem from LeetCode, a fascinating coding challenge. Whether you’re a tech enthusiast or just curious about what coders do, I’ve tailored this for everyone. I’m reaching out to Software Engineers, Backend Developers, Full Stack Developers, and hiring managers at startups, MAANG giants, and MNCs worldwide. Let’s connect and inspire each other! 🚀✨🌟 What’s This About? 🍽️Imagine sliding a small tray over a buffet table, picking the tastiest dish from each set. It’s a fun way to think about this problem!🌍 Real-World Relevance 🛒For non-tech folks, it’s like finding the best deal in a moving set of options; for techies, it’s spotting the largest number in a sliding window of a list.📊 Why It Matters 🧪This is a classic problem in data processing, often seen in interviews, testing how you handle efficiency.🕒 Common Use 📈Think of stock price analysis or real-time data streams where you need quick insights from moving data chunks.🔧 My Quick Approach 🧠I avoided the slow “check every single thing” method and used a smart “VIP list” (hint: a priority structure) to track potential top picks, updating as I slide. Super fast for big data! ⚡🛠️ Step 1: Understand 📝First, I broke down the idea of a moving frame over numbers, ensuring I knew exactly what to find.⚡ Step 2: Optimize ⏩Instead of rechecking everything, my VIP list only keeps track of numbers that could be the biggest, saving time.📋 Step 3: Execute ✅As the window moves, I update this list by dropping outdated or smaller values, always having the top number ready.📈 What I Learned 💪I mastered efficiency for scalable systems and how to explain complex ideas simply. A huge win for teamwork and real-world projects! 🌟🌱 Skill Growth 🚀This taught me to prioritize speed in coding, crucial for apps handling tons of data without lagging.🗣️ Communication 💬Simplifying this problem honed my ability to share tech concepts with non-tech teammates or clients.💡 Problem-Solving 🕵️‍♂️It reinforced my knack for finding creative shortcuts, a skill I’m eager to apply in professional settings.🤝 Why Share This? 🌎I’m hashtag#OpentoWork for hybrid/remote roles, especially in India, at startups or MAANG companies. Hiring Managers, Recruiters, HR pros-let’s talk! Tech pals, let’s swap ideas! 📢📩 Open to Connect 📧I’m keen to discuss opportunities where I can contribute to innovative tech solutions.🌐 Global Reach 🗺️I’m looking for roles worldwide, bringing adaptability and a passion for learning to any team.🤲 Collaboration 👥I’d love to brainstorm with fellow developers on this or other challenges to grow together.hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#BackendDeveloper hashtag#FullStackDeveloper hashtag#Python hashtag#Coding hashtag#LeetCode hashtag#TechJobs hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#Startups hashtag#MAANG hashtag#Technology hashtag#Innovation hashtag#Careers hashtag#JobOpening hashtag#Recruitment 🖥️📱📷 See the Visual ✨

It was a privilege to be a keynote speaker at an event last week organized by the Consulate General of India, San Francisco, featuring a powerhouse delegation of tech CEOs from India under the banner of nasscom. Looking around the room, it was a personal moment of pride to see a small sampling of the tremendous accomplishments and global impacts of the Indian tech industry over just 3 decades, and the immense potential for the future.The event also featured Prof. Arogyaswami Paulraj from Stanford University and Manthan Shah from WestBridge Capital, who talked about India's tech innovation journey and the bourgeoning investment environment.I spoke about the Digital Divide, both its growing challenges as well as the sizeable opportunity that it represents for India. Some stats that stand out:◽ Across Europe and the US, job requirements for digital skills are up by 50%◽ Per a recent survey, 1 in 3 workers lack foundational digital skills◽ 78% of companies admitted to lowering hiring standards due to lack of skills◽ While India and the US rank 2nd and 3rd in terms of Internet users, the ‘unconnected’ Indian population is 685M, twice the entire US population◽ $11.5T in GDP growth could be be missed across 14 G20 countries if the digital skills gap is not bridgedAnd, developments in AI could exacerbate – or address – that gap:◽ In share of knowledge workers using GenAI at work, India leads the world at 92%; the US is 5th with 71%◽ In contrast, the IMF’s AI Preparedness Index, based on a range of macro-structural factors, ranks the US 3rd with a score of 0.77 and India much lower at 0.49 ◽ AI Research Publication is a fascinating data point – China has shot to 1st place, outstripping the EU, US, and India (4th)The data points are stark. But so are the opportunities and choices ahead for Indian tech, including its impact on global tech trade. One of the keys, as I laid out, is the kind of ecosystems we build – especially as we work across blurring boundaries. The right ecosystems, formal and informal, create a "web of value" that enable new collaborations, accelerate innovations and learning, enable new business models, and foster new cultures. I shared with the group about how Hitachi effectively deploys such ecosystems to solve ‘wicked’, generational problems.There are differences between Silicon Valley and Indian tech, but they can become openings to bring the best of both worlds to bear.I am enthusiastic about what the future holds, especially as the bonds grow stronger between Silicon Valley and India. Many thanks to the Consul General Dr. Srikar Reddy Koppula, NASSCOM delegation leader Shivendra Singh, and co-organizers GITPRO (led by Khanderao Kand) and ITServe Alliance (led by Shabana Siraj), TiE Silicon Valley and ASEI (American Society of Engineers of Indian Origin).Hitachi Vantara GlobalLogic Hitachi America Ltd.hashtag#Ecosystems hashtag#IndiaUSCollaboration hashtag#TechForGood

What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. The truth is, respondents often won’t say the full story outright. Here’s where the gaps can appear:Asking the what but skipping the why. Overlooking emotional drivers behind decisions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Share your thoughts below—I’d love to hear from all the data storytellers out there! 🙌 hashtag#MarketResearch hashtag#DataAnalytics hashtag#CustomerInsights

Data Engineer ≠ Data Analyst ≠ ML EngineerLet’s break it down:✅ Data Engineer → Builds, optimizes, and maintains data pipelines, warehouses, and infrastructure.Tech stack: Spark, Kafka, Airflow, Snowflake, BigQuery, Hadoop, dbt✅ Data Analyst → Analyzes and visualizes data, builds reports, identifies trends & insights to support business decisions.Tech stack: SQL, Excel, Tableau, Power BI, Looker✅ ML Engineer → Builds, deploys, and maintains machine learning models in production.Tech stack: Python, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn, MLflow, Kubeflow💡Key takeaway: These roles complement each other but require very different skill sets.If you’re applying or hiring — make sure you’re clear on the differences!Happy to help anyone looking to pivot or clarify their path. Hey incredible LinkedIn folks across the globe! 🌍I’m thrilled to share my journey of cracking the Sliding Window Maximum problem from LeetCode, a fascinating coding challenge. Whether you’re a tech enthusiast or just curious about what coders do, I’ve tailored this for everyone. I’m reaching out to Software Engineers, Backend Developers, Full Stack Developers, and hiring managers at startups, MAANG giants, and MNCs worldwide. Let’s connect and inspire each other! 🚀✨🌟 What’s This About? 🍽️Imagine sliding a small tray over a buffet table, picking the tastiest dish from each set. It’s a fun way to think about this problem!🌍 Real-World Relevance 🛒For non-tech folks, it’s like finding the best deal in a moving set of options; for techies, it’s spotting the largest number in a sliding window of a list.📊 Why It Matters 🧪This is a classic problem in data processing, often seen in interviews, testing how you handle efficiency.🕒 Common Use 📈Think of stock price analysis or real-time data streams where you need quick insights from moving data chunks.🔧 My Quick Approach 🧠I avoided the slow “check every single thing” method and used a smart “VIP list” (hint: a priority structure) to track potential top picks, updating as I slide. Super fast for big data! ⚡🛠️ Step 1: Understand 📝First, I broke down the idea of a moving frame over numbers, ensuring I knew exactly what to find.⚡ Step 2: Optimize ⏩Instead of rechecking everything, my VIP list only keeps track of numbers that could be the biggest, saving time.📋 Step 3: Execute ✅As the window moves, I update this list by dropping outdated or smaller values, always having the top number ready.📈 What I Learned 💪I mastered efficiency for scalable systems and how to explain complex ideas simply. A huge win for teamwork and real-world projects! 🌟🌱 Skill Growth 🚀This taught me to prioritize speed in coding, crucial for apps handling tons of data without lagging.🗣️ Communication 💬Simplifying this problem honed my ability to share tech concepts with non-tech teammates or clients.💡 Problem-Solving 🕵️‍♂️It reinforced my knack for finding creative shortcuts, a skill I’m eager to apply in professional settings.🤝 Why Share This? 🌎I’m hashtag#OpentoWork for hybrid/remote roles, especially in India, at startups or MAANG companies. Hiring Managers, Recruiters, HR pros-let’s talk! Tech pals, let’s swap ideas! 📢📩 Open to Connect 📧I’m keen to discuss opportunities where I can contribute to innovative tech solutions.🌐 Global Reach 🗺️I’m looking for roles worldwide, bringing adaptability and a passion for learning to any team.🤲 Collaboration 👥I’d love to brainstorm with fellow developers on this or other challenges to grow together.hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#BackendDeveloper hashtag#FullStackDeveloper hashtag#Python hashtag#Coding hashtag#LeetCode hashtag#TechJobs hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#Startups hashtag#MAANG hashtag#Technology hashtag#Innovation hashtag#Careers hashtag#JobOpening hashtag#Recruitment 🖥️📱📷 See the Visual ✨

It was a privilege to be a keynote speaker at an event last week organized by the Consulate General of India, San Francisco, featuring a powerhouse delegation of tech CEOs from India under the banner of nasscom. Looking around the room, it was a personal moment of pride to see a small sampling of the tremendous accomplishments and global impacts of the Indian tech industry over just 3 decades, and the immense potential for the future.The event also featured Prof. Arogyaswami Paulraj from Stanford University and Manthan Shah from WestBridge Capital, who talked about India's tech innovation journey and the bourgeoning investment environment.I spoke about the Digital Divide, both its growing challenges as well as the sizeable opportunity that it represents for India. Some stats that stand out:◽ Across Europe and the US, job requirements for digital skills are up by 50%◽ Per a recent survey, 1 in 3 workers lack foundational digital skills◽ 78% of companies admitted to lowering hiring standards due to lack of skills◽ While India and the US rank 2nd and 3rd in terms of Internet users, the ‘unconnected’ Indian population is 685M, twice the entire US population◽ $11.5T in GDP growth could be be missed across 14 G20 countries if the digital skills gap is not bridgedAnd, developments in AI could exacerbate – or address – that gap:◽ In share of knowledge workers using GenAI at work, India leads the world at 92%; the US is 5th with 71%◽ In contrast, the IMF’s AI Preparedness Index, based on a range of macro-structural factors, ranks the US 3rd with a score of 0.77 and India much lower at 0.49 ◽ AI Research Publication is a fascinating data point – China has shot to 1st place, outstripping the EU, US, and India (4th)The data points are stark. But so are the opportunities and choices ahead for Indian tech, including its impact on global tech trade. One of the keys, as I laid out, is the kind of ecosystems we build – especially as we work across blurring boundaries. The right ecosystems, formal and informal, create a "web of value" that enable new collaborations, accelerate innovations and learning, enable new business models, and foster new cultures. I shared with the group about how Hitachi effectively deploys such ecosystems to solve ‘wicked’, generational problems.There are differences between Silicon Valley and Indian tech, but they can become openings to bring the best of both worlds to bear.I am enthusiastic about what the future holds, especially as the bonds grow stronger between Silicon Valley and India. Many thanks to the Consul General Dr. Srikar Reddy Koppula, NASSCOM delegation leader Shivendra Singh, and co-organizers GITPRO (led by Khanderao Kand) and ITServe Alliance (led by Shabana Siraj), TiE Silicon Valley and ASEI (American Society of Engineers of Indian Origin).Hitachi Vantara GlobalLogic Hitachi America Ltd.hashtag#Ecosystems hashtag#IndiaUSCollaboration hashtag#TechForGood

What is your target audience really thinking, but not telling you? 🕵️‍♂️ Even the best-designed surveys or feedback loops can miss key insights if they're too focused on surface-level questions. Assuming feedback silence means satisfaction. These unnoticed blind spots could mean missing out on valuable opportunities nested in unspoken feedback. When was the last time you re-evaluated your research or feedback process? Is it time to refine your methods? Hey incredible LinkedIn folks across the globe! 🌍I’m thrilled to share my journey of cracking the Sliding Window Maximum problem from LeetCode, a fascinating coding challenge. Whether you’re a tech enthusiast or just curious about what coders do, I’ve tailored this for everyone. I’m reaching out to Software Engineers, Backend Developers, Full Stack Developers, and hiring managers at startups, MAANG giants, and MNCs worldwide. Let’s connect and inspire each other! 🚀✨🌟 What’s This About? 🍽️Imagine sliding a small tray over a buffet table, picking the tastiest dish from each set. It’s a fun way to think about this problem!🌍 Real-World Relevance 🛒For non-tech folks, it’s like finding the best deal in a moving set of options; for techies, it’s spotting the largest number in a sliding window of a list.📊 Why It Matters 🧪This is a classic problem in data processing, often seen in interviews, testing how you handle efficiency.🕒 Common Use 📈Think of stock price analysis or real-time data streams where you need quick insights from moving data chunks.🔧 My Quick Approach 🧠I avoided the slow “check every single thing” method and used a smart “VIP list” (hint: a priority structure) to track potential top picks, updating as I slide. Super fast for big data! ⚡🛠️ Step 1: Understand 📝First, I broke down the idea of a moving frame over numbers, ensuring I knew exactly what to find.⚡ Step 2: Optimize ⏩Instead of rechecking everything, my VIP list only keeps track of numbers that could be the biggest, saving time.📋 Step 3: Execute ✅As the window moves, I update this list by dropping outdated or smaller values, always having the top number ready.📈 What I Learned 💪I mastered efficiency for scalable systems and how to explain complex ideas simply. A huge win for teamwork and real-world projects! 🌟🌱 Skill Growth 🚀This taught me to prioritize speed in coding, crucial for apps handling tons of data without lagging.🗣️ Communication 💬Simplifying this problem honed my ability to share tech concepts with non-tech teammates or clients.💡 Problem-Solving 🕵️‍♂️It reinforced my knack for finding creative shortcuts, a skill I’m eager to apply in professional settings.🤝 Why Share This? 🌎I’m hashtag#OpentoWork for hybrid/remote roles, especially in India, at startups or MAANG companies. Hiring Managers, Recruiters, HR pros-let’s talk! Tech pals, let’s swap ideas! 📢📩 Open to Connect 📧I’m keen to discuss opportunities where I can contribute to innovative tech solutions.🌐 Global Reach 🗺️I’m looking for roles worldwide, bringing adaptability and a passion for learning to any team.🤲 Collaboration 👥I’d love to brainstorm with fellow developers on this or other challenges to grow together.hashtag#SoftwareEngineer hashtag#BackendDeveloper hashtag#FullStackDeveloper hashtag#Python hashtag#Coding hashtag#LeetCode hashtag#TechJobs hashtag#Hiring hashtag#JobSearch hashtag#RemoteWork hashtag#Startups hashtag#MAANG hashtag#Technology hashtag#Innovation hashtag#Careers hashtag#JobOpening hashtag#Recruitment 🖥️📱📷 See the Visual ✨

It was a privilege to be a keynote speaker at an event last week organized by the Consulate General of India, San Francisco, featuring a powerhouse delegation of tech CEOs from India under the banner of nasscom. Looking around the room, it was a personal moment of pride to see a small sampling of the tremendous accomplishments and global impacts of the Indian tech industry over just 3 decades, and the immense potential for the future.The event also featured Prof. Arogyaswami Paulraj from Stanford University and Manthan Shah from WestBridge Capital, who talked about India's tech innovation journey and the bourgeoning investment environment.I spoke about the Digital Divide, both its growing challenges as well as the sizeable opportunity that it represents for India. Some stats that stand out:◽ Across Europe and the US, job requirements for digital skills are up by 50%◽ Per a recent survey, 1 in 3 workers lack foundational digital skills◽ 78% of companies admitted to lowering hiring standards due to lack of skills◽ While India and the US rank 2nd and 3rd in terms of Internet users, the ‘unconnected’ Indian population is 685M, twice the entire US population◽ $11.5T in GDP growth could be be missed across 14 G20 countries if the digital skills gap is not bridgedAnd, developments in AI could exacerbate – or address – that gap:◽ In share of knowledge workers using GenAI at work, India leads the world at 92%; the US is 5th with 71%◽ In contrast, the IMF’s AI Preparedness Index, based on a range of macro-structural factors, ranks the US 3rd with a score of 0.77 and India much lower at 0.49 ◽ AI Research Publication is a fascinating data point – China has shot to 1st place, outstripping the EU, US, and India (4th)The data points are stark. But so are the opportunities and choices ahead for Indian tech, including its impact on global tech trade. One of the keys, as I laid out, is the kind of ecosystems we build – especially as we work across blurring boundaries. The right ecosystems, formal and informal, create a "web of value" that enable new collaborations, accelerate innovations and learning, enable new business models, and foster new cultures. I shared with the group about how Hitachi effectively deploys such ecosystems to solve ‘wicked’, generational problems.There are differences between Silicon Valley and Indian tech, but they can become openings to bring the best of both worlds to bear.I am enthusiastic about what the future holds, especially as the bonds grow stronger between Silicon Valley and India.
